dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's unfair, Rachel. And completely untrue.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And she's even worse! "Dad, you're never going to believe this, but I lost the car again." "Dad, you're never going to believe this, but that check you sent me never showed up and my landlord hates me." "Dad, can somebody meet me downstairs with cab fare and you're never going to believe this but I need to go to the emergency room and my neighbor's suing me and my checkbook got stolen!"
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Gee, Rach, sounds like you have some paternal/sibling issues to work through. (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you kidding? The two of you are like a double helix of crises. In the language of psychology one could say you both suffer from acute boundary issues.

dialogue.raw_text: Rachel! It's nice that you're getting your Ph.D--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (she throws up her hands.) --Oh god--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: --but don't be patronizing. It's ugly. It doesn't become you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How come she gets to spout off about paternal issues, but god forbid I should even reference the "boundary thing," even though I actually know what I'm talking about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (waving her arms) Hello? By the way? I'm not in crisis. I haven't been in crisis for a year.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You just got out of rehab!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why is this so difficult for you people to understand? It's like you're not happy unless I'm in some kind of desperate situation. You have no idea what to do with me unless I'm desperate. God. Why am I the only one who's willing to say this stuff?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, poor you. You're so much more evolved in your suffering. You know what? Your suffering is not the most important thing in the world to everybody! (MORE) (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Rachel just stands there, not saying anything.

Kym breaks from Paul's vice-like grip.

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) There are billions and billions and billions of people, in nations all over the world, who never even think about you! Other people have lives! We have lives! I have a life! I'm in school. I'm getting married. I'm...

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Congratulations! Oh my god! Etc!!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That is so unfair!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (ecstatic) When did you find out?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Roughly about the day before we decided to get married.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can barely believe it myself!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (laughing, mushing Rachel's belly) (MORE) (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Beat. All the energy drains out of Rachel.

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) How long? How much pregnant? Did you tell your mother?

dialogue.raw_text: We told her at dinner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She was so happy--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait! Stop! You can't just drop that tectonic bit of information into a completely separate conversation, Rachel. You can't do that!

dialogue.raw_text: Kym, you're going to have a niece!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Or a nephew!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, god. Of course I'm happy for you. But you can't tell me when we're talking like this. It's a total set-up!

dialogue.raw_text: I am so fucking exhausted.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dad, will you tell her I'm happy for her?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I just...I need to go to bed. Sidney?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, okay. Great idea. I'm beat too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Rachel) You're leaving? In the middle of this conversation?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. (CONTINUED)

dialogue.raw_text: Kymmie, she's pregnant. She's exhausted.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, Rachel darling, and Sidney, I couldn't be happier.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're pretty everything!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (kissing her again) Of course not. I'll be up, Carol. I'm just going to load the dishwasher. (CONTINUED)

dialogue.raw_text: Don't mess with the King.

dialogue.raw_text: Okay,okay.

dialogue.raw_text: We were in the park. I was sixteen and I was...I had taken all these Percoset. I was unbelievably high. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

And he had his red socks and he was running around kicking up the leaves. You know in movies where they show a person's high or whatever and the camera careens all around? It was like that. But fun. You know. We were having so much fun. We were leaping around in huge piles of leaves. He buried me. I buried him in a big pile. I was on baby sitting detail. He was pretending he was a train. So he was charging through the leaf pile, making tracks, you know? I was the caboose. And he kept going "Coal, caboose! Coal caboose!" So it's time to go and we're driving home and he's in his car seat still demanding coal, and I couldn't focus and I drove off the bridge. The car went into the lake. I couldn't get him out of his car seat. He drowned.

dialogue.raw_text: They're bringing the car around.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're leaving?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Darling, I'm exhausted. I had such a marvelous time. Those dancers were so beautiful. But weddings are really for young people. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Kym doesn't say anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She bends in for a kiss.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) I thought we'd just sneak off and not make a big scene.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You could make a little scene.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And here I am making it. Andrew and I are going to Washington in the morning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why are you going to Washington?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's the mother of all fund raisers at American. I thought I mentioned it. We're going to stay on about a week - there are lots of meetings. I thought since you two are going away soon... (to Kym) ...and I'm sure you don't want any grown ups around checking up on you...Will you still be here when I get back?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What about our post-nuptial wedding gossip reconnaissance, Mom?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, can you come by early?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Um...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course you don't want to do that. It's your wedding night. You don't want to get up early. I have to get Andrew organized. He's hopeless. And we'll be back in a bit. It was such a lovely wedding, darling.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait! I want my mother and my sister! (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Rachel wraps one arm around Kym's neck and the other round her mother and hugs them both to her. She has her eyes open. They have their eyes open. They are stiff as boards. Rachel stops hugging and looks from one to the other. Her mom and sister look at her and each other. Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She pats Rachel's tummy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kym and Rachel watch their mother leave the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kym sees Abby and Andrew crossing the front porch through the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kym moves quickly from the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Rachel...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Will you call me every day about...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. Of course.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right, then.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Goodbye Abby.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good bye, Son-in-law.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (horrified) I saw your mother's underwear.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't find my cigarettes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BUCHMAN FOYER. NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kym is heading for the front door, when Paul breaks away from a group of guests having coffee in the dining room and nabs her, pulling her into a conversation with a WEDDING GUEST. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kym is looking out the dining room window between Paul and Susanna -- she spots Abby and Andrew walking down the driveway towards the VALETS at the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Susanna and Paul laugh.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Kymmie. Speak of the devil. You remember Susanna Galeano.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (she doesn't) Hi.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hi Kym.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Susanna has a public relations firm and she just lost one of her assistants.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Weddings. They're an epidemic. Your father gave me my start about a hundred years ago.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, no. Hardly. Well...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We could definitely use an extra body right about now. Have you ever thought about Public Relations?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The public is kind of afraid of me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The firm is opening an office right here in town, just in time for the holidays. You could stay right here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Have you ever thought about P.R. Kym?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Logistically it's just a dream. You could stay in your old room. I could chauffeur you around. You wouldn't have to worry about rent. (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: She hands Kym a business card and kisses Paul on the cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She leaves.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Have you already talked to Carol about me staying here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course. She's fine about it. You could stay in your old room.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why don't you give me a call on Monday, okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Goodbye Paul. It was just beautiful. Bye Kym.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Suzy's first rate. P.R. can be fascinating.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You always said it was stupid.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I meant stupid. Do you want me to hold that for you? You've got no pockets.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've got it. Thanks, Dad. I'll be right back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . FRONT PORCH. NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At the edge of the porch Kym sees Abby standing in the moonlight at the front of the driveway with Andrew, waiting for their car. Kym pauses. Abby turns her head slightly in Kym's direction. Kym, in the half dark, watches her mother. Abby does not move a muscle. Kym steps off the porch. The valet pulls up in the car, jumps out. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Abby fixes her gaze on Andrew as he opens the door for her. They drive off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUCHMAN BACKYARD. MORNING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Absolute End of a Wedding. The place is a gorgeous mess of wedding detritus. The tent looks so lonely. A weary caterer packs away his trays. Kieran is talking and smoking with Sidney at the end of the lawn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ETHAN'S ROOM. DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A freshly scrubbed Kym, in her own clothes, takes a moment in Ethan's room. She collects a few snapshots of her sister and brother and stuffs them in her shoulder bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . UPSTAIRS HALLWAY. DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Kym approaches the stairs, Emma staggers into the hallway, bleary-eyed. She is in her underwear, heading for the bathroom. She stops at the sight of Kym. They stare at each other. Emma gives a tiny wave. Kym responds, heads down the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUCHMAN STAIRWAY. DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kym slipping quietly downstairs. She moves to collect her weird mish-mash of bags waiting by the door. Kieran is there.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oof. You scared me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Making a break for it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. I have to go. I was coming to find you. (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Kieran hands Kym a folded piece of paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He smiles, kisses her, tenderly. She hugs him fiercely.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You don't have to slip away without making any noise, you know? I like noise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was coming to find you. My ride's outside.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...Okay...If you need anything...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If I need to post bond?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. If you ever need anything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you, Kieran.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe you'll come visit me in Hawaii?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That would be nice.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have to go. Bye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . FRONT PORCH. DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kym looks back in through the window, sees her father awake, in his robe, tired, gamely tidying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carol comes up behind Paul, envelopes him in a gentle bear hug.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (unbelievably softly and tenderly) Dad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BUCHMAN DRIVEWAY. DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: `98 maroon CAMRY is idling in the circular driveway out front, exhaust vaporizing against the chilly morning air. A cute two-year-old girl is visible in a carseat and Rosa, the staff nurse from Kym's halfway house, is at the wheel. The car radio plays quietly as Kym opens the passenger door, wiggling her finger at the little girl. Like a ghost, Rachel appears on the porch. Kym jumps a little. The sisters lock eyes. Kym looks pained. Paul is still moving around in there. She wants to go. Rachel floats down the porch stairs and joins her sister at the car. She takes in Rosa who meets Rachel's look with a nod.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rachel nods. Kym is crying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rachel hugs her sister fiercely. Kym gets into the passenger seat but leaves the car door open. Rachel smiles her huge, luminous smile. Kym shuts the car door and rolls down the window.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hi.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hi.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (whispering) Will you tell Dad?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I love your baby!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Me too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) Bye! (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue
